item.title: Donald Williams
item.dc:creator: Melissa Hay
item.description:
Donny Williams is a research scientist with over five years of experience in advanced statistical methodology, including mixed models, causal inference and time series, meta-analysis, and Bayesian statistics. He specializes

The post Donald Williams appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
Donny Williams is a research scientist with over five years of experience in advanced statistical methodology, including mixed models, causal inference and time series, meta-analysis, and Bayesian statistics. He specializes in developing statistical software for solving problems in the social-behavioral sciences. He is the author of 30 peer-reviewed publications, including high-impact work appearing in prestigious quantitative journals such as Psychological Methods and Multivariate Behavior Research. Donny is a PhD candidate in quantitative psychology at the University of California, Davis.

The post Donald Williams appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: Meredith Langi, PhD
item.dc:creator: Melissa Hay
item.description:
Meredith Langi specializes in educational measurement and latent variable modeling and is particularly interested in how assessments can support classroom instruction. Prior to joining NWEA, she supported psychometrics for the

The post Meredith Langi, PhD appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
Meredith Langi specializes in educational measurement and latent variable modeling and is particularly interested in how assessments can support classroom instruction. Prior to joining NWEA, she supported psychometrics for the English Language Proficiency Assessment (ELPA21). She also served as a teacher and resource specialist with the Peace Corps in Tonga.  Dr. Langi holds a PhD in social research methodology and an MS in statistics from the University of California, Los Angeles, as well as an EdM in international education policy from the Harvard Graduate School of Education.

The post Meredith Langi, PhD appeared first on NWEA.
